having recently had my 3Gs stolen... it was as though my entire life was being grabbed and lifted away... yes, the apps that i'd downloaded were useful and sometimes entertaining... but it was the calendar, the photos, and the history of 11 months that disappeared before my eyes... dependent, oh yes... able to live without my iphone - yes... but grateful that a friend chose to give me her old 3G (and boo to at&t w/their early upgrade restrictions).

I would like an iPad app that contains a good, up-to-date, zoomable, street-level map of the U.S. but that does NOT require a net connection.  I know it would take several GB of space to store the map data, but I have that space.  I would pay $10 for it easily.

In addition, for street parking, the available spot would be measured to make sure that the space would be adequate for your car.  This app would require street sensors all around the city.
To those who're asking others to get a life. You go ahead and enjoy your definition of life the way you want to, don't lecture the rest of us.

I've been scanning the comments to see the two things that re most obvious to me. They may be here, somewhere in the last few pages, but I don't have the patience to read them all, so I'll post them, even if I run the risk of being redundant.

1. The fact that BP could come up with this "solution" simply begs the question. Where has the oil industry been for over 20 years? This was the most obvious danger in deep water drilling, and somehow they never put the money into the research until AFTER the worst had happened? This recklessness not only supports reparation, it also suggests that anybody involved in the sham that licensed them to start this drilling should be barred from any business in US waters.

2. What is this reflexive invective about Obama? I don't hear any of those folks blaming Reagan for the Exxon Valdez or for its cleanup. Instead, they whine about Katrina, conveniently forgetting that American citizens died and suffered there because there was no water, no food, no medicine, and no rescue -- the Coast Guard pilots who bravely went in immediately to rescue people were ordered back.

Useless. These robots don't want to think, they just want to blame Obama for everything they can complain about. Have they gotten to the weather yet?

I too am one of those who live in a country other than my birth country and while a legal immigrant, I live in constant fear of being demonised, having the rules changed out from under me, or falling foul of some arcane technicality used for no other reason than to lower immigrant numbers regardless of their contribution to their adopted home country.

These people publishing detailed personal information about these immigrants is truely scary. What's next? Kristalnacht? I am sure they are the same ones who support Republican calls to repeal the new financial regulation.

Amen. I had the same issue when I got a greencard for my husband. We still live in London and I face the same problems now trying to get British citizenship. I have been here continuoulsly legally for more than 7 years and have watched the rules change every six months or so and my date for naturalisation move out over and over again.

Now I am filing for permanent residency and live in constant fear they will find some riduculous technicality to say I am illegal. My daughter was born here. I have been in Europe for more than 13 years (with 3 spent in Germany). I have worked here longer than I ever did in the US. What kind of life would I face if deported? My international experience and language skills are of very little value in the insular USA. Not to mention the whole health care issue.

It is insulting since I have paid tax in Britain for a total of 10 years on a salary that is in the top 2% of earnings here (not to mention my husbands contributions). On top of that, I pay my nanny a great salary including tax and social security. Her benefits that I supply are far far better than most American's. What on earth would Britain have to gain by deporting me? One less name to add to the number of immigrants? Ridiculous.
People should immigrate the right way, that is lawfully.

You're 100% right Sarah. My experience with the new arrivals, whether they hold papers or not, has been overwhelmingly positive. You may feel as though you're swimming against the tide at times, but never stop trying. I think it's all too easy for a lot of people to single out this particular group when execs are ripping us off for big bucks left and right.

They would not be standing around if English speaking US citizens were not hiring them. Its called capitalism. Demand and supply.

If you restrict who people can hire, would there not be cries of socialism and communism? Where is the Tea Party when you need them!

.."And that’s one reason — there are others — why you should fear the consequences if the G.O.P. actually does as well in November as it hopes."

Yes, Yes, Yes, Professor Krugman. And that is the reason that all of those Independents out there who are "P.Od" at Obama and the Democrats and plan to vote Republican or just not to vote--for spite--are going to be cutting off their noses to spite their you-know-whats! I want to ask you people: have you really thought about what you say you intend to do? Do you really want to bring back Mitch McConnell as Senate Majority Leader and John Boehner as Speaker of the House? Really, DO YOU? If your answer is "Yes," then I think you are have stinking thinking. If your answer is "No," then please recover from your betrayed feelings and vote for the Democrat (or the Independent).

I have never seen so clearly how devious, pathological and crazy-making the strategy of passive-aggression can be as I have watching Republicans in the House and Senate these last two years. And don't get me started on the right-wing PACS! It is true the Democrats are not as effective as they could and should be. It is also true that they are hamstrung by the rabid Blue Dogs who might as well be Republicans. What all of us who believe what Professor Krugman is saying need to do before the Fall elections is to work like mad for Progressive Democrats! They can and must win some seats held by some of the crazies! This is the only way we can bring some sanity back into the legislative process.

comments.commentBody:
It’s not only voodoo econ here – it’s Citizens United voodoo.

The Supreme Court, in its recent case endowing full personhood on Corporate America, didn’t just elevate the groveling to the rich that you cite in senators today. It didn’t just elevate the Golden Calf as the only ethics all know who’ve spent time in biz and law schools.

The Citizens United case, rather, clarified the new, voodoo form of humanity – the de-natured “person” who can feel no accountability to any commonweal, any land or waters. This voodoo “person,” like the craven senators you mention, can’t really help himself or herself. He or she is trained – legally enshrined – to live only for most immediate greed – no other community or actual humanity considerations obtain. The schools have assiduously been helping to template this ghoul, and intend to do more so now under ed sec Arne Duncan’s “instrumentalism,” reducing all teachers, all students, all life to what’s measurable, multiple-choiceable, trackable, rankable – no other humanity need apply. Numbers, numbers, numbers. That and its corollary gain, gain, gain – profit, profit, profit – explains why the slick senators can’t see how totally they’ve prostituted themselves, and will prostitute all government. They are the outlandishly obvious hypocrites you note. They serve only corporate voodoo and “people” who smell only like paper (greenbacks, greenbacks, stock options, stock options.).

Your two cats, Albert and Doris, have more humanity than these senators – no one expects them, at least, to idolize the degraded forms of life to which the senators and court justices so nakedly pander.

Much like Dorian Gray, Gibson's picture becomes uglier with each new sin. The deal with the devil seems almost complete.

Oscar Wilde once said, “To love oneself is the beginning of a life-long romance” The trouble with this romance is its increased intensity. Mad Max has finally gone mad to the max losing whatever conscience he once had.

As an antidote to Mel Gibson and his ilk, maybe it's time to read or re-read a good biography of George C. Marshall (such as Ed Cray's or for the really ambitious Forrest Pogue's).  I believe Marshall is the only U.S. military officer to receive the Nobel Peace Prize.  He combined a high level of intelligence and competence with a selfless dedication to whatever his job required, whether staff officer to General Pershing, Army Chief of Staff and principal military adviser to Pres. Roosevelt during WWII, or Secretary of State.  And when it was all over, he turned down $1M (in the 1950s) for his memoir lest he embarrass any former associates.  Maybe Mel should study Marshall's life. . . . .

Mel Gibson is a very troubled man in need of serious rehab and professional and spiritual help.

Gibson has made quite a few very macho films from Braveheart to Mad Max to Lethal Weapon to Apocalypto all the way to The Passion of the Christ.

Most critics agree that his films are very good. The box office has shown him to be a very good film maker and his films have made hundreds of millions to Billions of dollars.

Mr. Gibson needs our prayers and support. If he handles his path to good emotional and spiritual health correctly--his example will be of help to millions of others who share problems similar to his.

Brooks, why were you so much easier on George Steinbrenner than on Mel Gibson? Both displayed the same egomania and indulged in the same torrentially abusive behavior. Is it just because you heard Gibson on tape? Does Steinbrenner's death merit a whitewash?

Abusive is abusive. There should be no excusing it, no matter how rich or charismatic the abuser is.

Actually I suspect he's Borderline, a personality disorder known also as BPD. He's too angry to be a narcissist, such persons rarely like to lose their cool. Read your DSM-IV TR first . Look at the criteria, chart it out. Then make the 25 cent diagnosis like the rest of us.

It's not his hurt self esteem that's at stake, it's his existence as a separate person.

The narcissism of American society described in the Twenge and other books, while interesting and possibly true - does not correlate to individuals suffering from Narcissistic Personality Disorder.

At least that's my understanding.

My only argument with this would be at the very end.  Receiving an affirmative answer when you ask teenagers whether or not they are "important," I would claim is a huge step in the right direction.  Deeming oneself an important human being is not wrong or narcissistic.  Otherwise, a very well written and interesting article.

Brooks says that Mel Gibson "seems" to be the apotheosis of a narcissist. I strongly disagree.

Mr. Gibson (by his own admission) suffers from substance abuse. He has abused alcohol many times in the past and he has been quite open about his problem.

Mr. Gibson badly needs to enter a serious Alcohol Treatment Program as well as an Anger Management Program.

Narcissism is possibly one of Gibson's problems--but the immediate issue to be addressed is his Alcohol and Anger Issues.
